message.body: sore, eh?
yep
good weekend then?
Sure
Really hectic
indeed. I'm off to work...
Cool.
Btw, the sore has to do with my combat fitness class yesterday.
whoa, that
is weird
Have no idea what you're getting at
I could have sworn you said, "Have fun" after my "I'm off to work"
signed out, then signed in again, now says "cool"
Yeah, I said cool.
hmmm
"have fun" is something I would have said though
guess I'm out of my mind
oh, and I'm no longer off to work
I have too much to do around here
Is that a good thing or bad thing?
meh, indifferent. I can do it tomorrow
fuck. I forgot what I was looking for
http://imgur.com/r/funny/Q0oyf
I'm curious to check your facebook now
oh, and so the camping this turns out was this coming weekend, not last =|
^is
So you didn't miss it, yay.
Also, that is not my picture/I did not caption it.
understood, but you did link to it so I though perhaps you were relating
and yes, yay. I'm planning on going this time and have some friends that are as well. Interested?
Nah, I just liked the "OH LAWD" part
Already have plans
Otherwise I'd probably be interested
I actually don't have 100% open weekends until mid-June =(
yeah, it a tough one. about a 3.5 hr drive so it's a bit of a commitment
I'm prolly leaving fri afternoon/evening and returning sunday
while other friends are leaving sat afternoon and some staying til monday
I have stuff Friday, Saturday, and Sunday.
lol
I generally try to avoid those situations. I always end up with stuff to do but like to keep my options open?
maybe Im just non-commital?
Question mark?
lol
yeah, see
Most of the time, I do not like last-minute plans.
"I live my life a 1/4 mile at a time"
so the other night we were discussing the courting process, and the respective roles of men and women
We as in you and me or as in you and other people?
I mentioned how as males, we are expected to do both the initial 'asking out' as well as the follow-up correspondence
In my experience, men don't seem to enjoy being pursued.
I think it just confuses them
the discussion the other night:
"all men are assholes"
"no, not all men. There are decent guys out there"
"well all the guys I go out with are"
"do you ever ask guys out?"
"no. how do you do that?"
"you say, 'would you like to go out sometime?'"
"oh, well I dont do that"
"So, in other words, all men that ask you out are assholes"
Yep
now, granted, this woman was 42 y/o
a bit "old fashioned" she did admit
Old-fashioned or not, if I really like a guy, I'd almost rather prefer _not_ asking him out on the chance it "confuses" him and ruins my chances

but I find that even younger, more progressive women tend to feel that it's just not their responsibility to as a man out or pursue them in any way, then complain that there aren't any decent guys out there (that will ask them out)
yeah, if guys did that the species would die out
The whole point, though, is that guys are perpetuating this dichotomy in their own way.
You bitch about asking girls out, but as soon as one does, you treat her like she's out-of-her-mind forward
some guys yes, but I don't think most men care
I've been asked out/pursued before and it wasn't a big deal
Outliers don't really count for anything.
thanks
we are talking in generalities here. obviously some women do ask men out
and I understand the hesitation of the rest
BUT, my main complaint is the complete lack of effort in terms of communication
If you have to do all the work, she's not interested enough to waste your time on.
agreed
So move on.
No complaining necessary.
=P
I would, if they weren't ALL like that
Are they **all** like that, or are all the chicks you are pursuing just not that interested?
=P
certainly a possibility, but they do get back to me (usually) after I make the first move at communicating
So they're interested enough to respond, but not to initiate.
exactly
this is what I find confusing/frustrating. I end up at the point where I'm just like, fuck it, I'm not going to call/txt/whatever
That or they're interested but trying to maintain the more powerful position in the relationship
So don't.
Just move on.
seems futile
So give up.
ok
Problem solved. ^_^
thx
Seriously though, you're not the only person that has this problem.
of course not
I encounter the same thing most of the time, with the genders swapped.
eh?
So you can drop the gender factor, really.
I don't see how
Because it has nothing to do with gender.
That's how.
Men can be just as nonresponsive and noncommunicative
technically yes, but it generally doesn't happen that way
When I'm interested in someone, I tend to be pretty assertive on keeping in contact, and I usually face exactly the same thing that you're talking about.
Not in _your_ experience, maybe.
My anecdotal evidence is just as valid as yours.
hmmm
More likely than your gender-based generalizing is that *you* are more conversationally assertive/impatient than most of the chicks you express interest in
So *you* expect more/communicate more than they do
do you find that you distance yourself more now due to these past experiences? Maybe you're just dating the wrong guys =o
Maybe you're approaching the wrong girls.
I do intentionally distance myself now.
I make an effort to not give a fuck
there you go
If they respond, they respond. If not, they just weren't that interested.
I'd rather not give a fuck than to take it personally.
you're admitting to intentionally communicating less not because you want less communication but because of what you expect will happen as a result of it
Problem?
therefore, m'dear, you DO give a fuck
I never said that I didn't.
I have a lot of self-esteem issues tied into people liking me. Just like most people do.
I would love to say that I don't care if these women get back to me, but I do. I find most men don't and just move on (numbers guys)
I'm becoming more of a numbers girl these days.
But I'm not looking for true love, either, which makes it easier.
right, so you've got more of a guy mentality and I have more of a girl mentality

a guy will hit on every woman he sees (Lee) at a party because he assumes it's a numbers game and increases his chances. A girl will look for the guy she finds the most attractive and set her sights on him
I'm going middle ground
Discerning, but not invested.
biologically speaking, it makes sense. A woman produces a few hundred eggs in her life, a man produces millions of sperm a day
women are more picky then men
Women are actually born with all their eggs... so it's not so much "produces", not in the same way.
That's because we're more detail oriented.
It's kind of weird, though
We're more picky at first, but we're a lot less picky when emotions are involved, I think
Like we have these lists of ideal traits
well, I did say "produce in her life" so not completely inaccurate
But if we're emotionally interested in someone who doesn't meet any of those things, it doesn't seem to matter as much as it does with men
so you'll stay with a guy after he's gained weight?
Depends on the degree and what the extenuating circumstances are.
eh, I feel it's the same with guys though
Maybe.
Guys seem to verbally express otherwise; whether they actually live by that, I haven't really observed.
I generally don't think about the after effects of dating, Im more interested in the courting process intricacies
I care more about personality than looks if I'm looking for someone to date.
all women say that
but it's not always true
WHAT? PEOPLE LIE?
Seriously, of course they would say that.
It's not even that, it's that they don't realize what they are doing
As a culture, we don't value women who assert that they care only about looks.
they trick themselves more than anything
Of course not, people lie to themselves all the time.
Not just about dating lists
Our culture doesn't value meaningful introspection and honesty either =P
We just care about presenting ourselves to best effect
in reality, I feel women are concerned with looks just as much as men
I would say most women are not as interested in looks as men say that men are into looks.
true
I used to (think) I cared a lot more than I do
There can be no true comparison because we all shade our assertions in culturally expected ways.
I care more than I used to, but only to a point.
my friend Brian (I don't know if you met him, chubby bearded guy w/ glasses)
Ice cream guy?
yes, i should probably just say that
Yes.
You can even acronymize it
ICG
he's a decent guy, funny, smart, successful, a musician, makes his own ice cream
I haven't really talked to him, otherwise his name would (maybe) actually stick
I literally had him in my phone as Brian K. Icecream
for about 3 months
anyway, whenever I talk to my female friends, they're always like, "eh, i don't find him attractive"
Ok, I get it. a supermodel he ain't, but he's not an awful looking guy either, and these girls arent' exactly supermodels themselves
If I'm recalling the right person, he's facially somewhat cute, but he's heavy. That's a pretty big mark on the superficial side of things.
he's heavy, but not obese. These girls aren't exactly petite themselves, so kinda makes them hypocrites
And when you're talking about picking people up, it's all based on superficial stuff.
don't get me wrong, I don't wanna date the dude either
Before like a year or two ago, his weight wouldn't have been that much of a detraction for me, just because I didn't really care.
Assuming that I liked his personality enough.
yeah, but when Im talking to these girls its not like at a party or something were they just met, its people that know him and run in similar circles
Which, based on other things you've told me, I wouldn't.
Yeah, well, based on things you've said, his personality isn't exactly a sparkling beacon of quality either.
no he's a creep in some ways
You can look good on paper and still be unattractive in person.
but usually only when he's pursuing a girl. In a group he is fine, just don't go on a date with him alone :-o
You might think he's fine in a group, but maybe he's still sending out 'red flags' that only the girls are picking up on
That or he's hit on them before and they know he's a creep
my point is, I don't think it's his personality that they aren't attracted too. Lee is just as creepy and the girls don't seem to mind because he's better looking
Lee is a weird looking kid
Lee is more charming.
He also comes off as an asshole, not a creep
still, the girls don't seem to mind
my point: girls are just as shallow as men
That's because he comes across as a jerkish little boy
Not as a creepy man
Lee's like "this is all a game"
funny thing is, Brian can't stand Lee
Because Lee's more successful
yup
and Lee thinks Brian is awesome
Brian, based on what I've seen and what you've said, probably comes off as more bitter and angry and pervy, which will likely come through as threatening
That was awkwardly phrased
hahaha. I remember when Lee had this pornstar mustache. funniest fucking thing I've ever seen
yeah, it's pretty much true though

I don't find Lee all that attractive, physically. And smoking is a major turn-off for me. His attitude makes him seem fun and chaotic, which is actually also a bit of a turn off for me. I'm not big into chaos.
Val doesn't seem to mind
But his actual personality, like him as a person, is pretty attractive.
Good for her.
People finding different things attractive is not breaking news
though she complains constantly about him
That's her thing.
I think she does it to try keeping him in place.
Half-assed speculation.
different strokes for different folks
probably true
He comes across with this huge ego, so she matches it with not-harsh complaints to break it down
she's pretty tough for her age
she's by far the youngest in the group
I don't know enough about her to conjecture on that front

anywho, my thing is I pursue a girl that I fancy for a while, then she kind of falls off the face of the earth. I may send her a polite text saying, "hey, how've you been..." or something to that effect. I don't hear back, or I do like days later. I feel it's just pointless. Why go through all the trouble?
Maybe you're moving too slow
Or being too impatient
and yes, i realize we covered this earlier but moving on is never that simple
Maybe your timing just sucks
Insofar as being incompatible with other people's
maybe. It's ALL about timing
This is why I've pretty much sworn off online dating
Too much guesswork/investment
You either need to just meet up within the first month or wait it out til you know each other for awhile.
part of the problem is, and this may speak for impatience, I've always had success with dating. It was always fairly easy for me and girls liked me. I got cocky /shrug
So start picking up more girls IRL?
I have nothing against it
and i feel that women prefer it over OD
more romantic or some shit
most of the women I meet in real life I end up being friends with :-/
Probably still your timing
And possibly your conversational material
Don't talk about other girls with your romantic interests ;)
I feel like that's a hint of some kind...
Depends on what you mean as a hint.
Per our previous discussions, I don't really look at you as a romantic interest. We are friends these days.
I don't mind you talking about anything, pretty much.
right, but doesn't mean you want me talking to you about other girls either
Doesn't bother me, really.
I feel like I do pretty well about keeping it reasonable
It definitely made me WTF back in 2010 though
When you started talking about how this other girl started talking to you again and blah blah blah
yeah, you didn't stop talking to me though
Uh, I kind of did, haha
I was just being honest
oh yeah
There was absolutely no reason for you to divulge any of that information to me, really
We _weren't_ dating
eh, I felt there was
We were just going out casually at that point
no but we had been out on dates
So?
There was absolutely no level of exclusivity on the table
ugh, women. you are impossible
We were both completely free to date/go out on dates with other people
So your "honesty" made it seem like you were a lot more serious about things than I was
And that you were _far_ more interested in that other chick
I was trying to convey that I didn't really know what was going on in terms of my interest for you due to this other girl being involved
You don't need to say that
I take everything seriously
haha
It can be serious, but your full disclosure was unnecessary, since it was already implicit in the level of dating we were engaging in at the time =P
and honestly, I was more interested in the other chick, mainly because she didnt seem indifferent
That's fine
I'm not saying you hurt my feelings or anything
understood and i agree, but I felt that this case was unique due to the fact that she was having an affect on how I felt about you
Understandable, I guess
You still didn't need to tell me
of course not
I guess I just thought that honesty would be more appreciated
It was over-disclosed, I guess
You could have just gone with "my schedule's going to be getting busier soon"
well I didn't tell you about my wife, so..
Haha.
that's kinda bullshit though
It's not
You didn't owe me any other explanation at that point
because that is read as:em, I'm kinda not really into you...
Which was the case.
not...exactly
as I recall, I was trying to make that known
In any case. I don't know how you usually talk to your women, but I'd recommend minimizing as many references to _other_ women as possible.
Not necessarily including female friends, but even that's probably advisable.
eh
Until you're actually getting serious, your dating details are irrelevant
I happen to have female friends, I don't see how that is any deterrent
Depends on whether they're single and how often you talk about them
If you talk about any of them with any sort of frequency, there may be speculation about your interest in them
If we were dating and every time I talked about what I'd been doing lately it included my friend Jesse, you'd probably start wondering if I was interested in him or if he was interested in me.
meh, I'd assume it were a girl
MY FRIEND PAUL.
Or Darren.
Or Joe.
I mean if you brought him up like every 5 minutes then yes
I'm not talking about constantly, I'm talking about consistently.
nah, but Im not most guys
I generally refrain from using names anyway, as they are usually irrelevant
sometimes this makes gender hidden, "I was with my friend the other day at the football game..."
other times it doesn't, "my friend told me that she hates having doors opened for her..."
